newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Hocheng limit up on speculative buying.
newsitem.headline: Hocheng limit up on speculative buying.

text.p: Several Taiwan shares, including sanitaryware maker Hocheng, surged at mid-morning on Monday in a move linked to probable speculative buying after lagging recent gains, brokers said.
With 75 minutes left, Hocheng rose by the daily seven percent limit to T$54.5, and electronics firm Systex was also limit up at the same T$54.5.
Brokers attributed the surge to their lagging recent gains.
"I cannot find specific reasons for their gains except that they lagged recent rallies," said Yuanta Securities analyst Henry Chen. "Overall, the index should enter into consolidation."
